results.idea: Cross-sectional sentiment gap: relpopularity08 minus avgranking
results.description: Used SUGGESTION1 to combine two complementary sentiment fields (snt27_relpopularity08_11, snt27_avgranking_19). SUGGESTION2 not applied (no vector fields identified). Confidence set to 0.78 based on high user/alpha counts and conceptual orthogonality.

Single-field time-series momentum using snt27_avgranking_19. S1 minimal (single field) but consistent with focus on time-series signal. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 applied: avgranking has high user/alpha counts. Followed KEEP_IN_MIND limits. Confidence 0.72 reflecting reliable history but moderate decay risk.

Combine skewness (snt27_skewness_21) as a contrarian cross-sectional signal. S1 used single but high-info field. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 applied: skewness has highest user/alpha counts so high coverage. Implementation kept compact. Confidence 0.83 due to strong historical usage.

Use snt27_kurtosis_16 to identify abnormal ranking distributions and trade when kurtosis is extreme. S1 single-field. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 used: kurtosis has good user/alpha counts. Kept operators minimal. Confidence 0.68 reflecting moderate structural risk.

Compare two popularity measures snt27_relpopularity1_14 and snt27_relpopularity08_11 to detect calibration shifts. S1 applied by combining both fields. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 considered both fields have decent counts. Implementation concise. Confidence 0.66 because ratios sometimes noisy.

Compare top ranking (snt27_topranking_7) with average ranking to highlight concentrated interest. S1 used both fields. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 applied; chosen fields have reasonable user/alpha counts. Implementation minimal. Confidence 0.70 as concentrated interest often predicts moves.
